data.title: Remove all personal information from metrics reporting
Return an object instead of array from Pasteboard::read
data.body:
Seemed weird that it returns an array of `[text, metadata]` instead of an object with `{text, metadata}` keys.

@nathansobo @probablycorey any feelings on this?

data.title: Make CLI installation easier.
data.body:
On startup Atom will try and install `apm` and `atom` to /usr/local/bin. If it can't a warning is logged to the console.

If the command `window:install-shell-commands` is triggered or the `Atom > Install Shell Commands` menu item is clicked a dialog will pop-up on success or failure.

![menubar-3](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/596/1980314/72857696-83bf-11e3-9ddd-871549e45982.jpg)

![menubar](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/596/1980300/2f608518-83bf-11e3-8b12-76208b7c34f1.jpg)

Fixes #1270

data.title: Can't decrease font size
data.body: I can increase font size with cmd-+, but cannot decrease the font size with cmd--, or cmd-0. Is there a place to set this?

data.title: Cannot read property 'classList' of undefined
data.body:
I saw this error while increasing the size of the tree view by dragging its edge to the right. I've seen this a few times now, but I have a hard time reproducing it on purpose.

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'classList' of undefined  gutter.coffee:238
```

Ironically, as I was creating this issue, I did something to trigger a second similar error:

```
> Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'classList' of undefined  gutter.coffee:241
  (anonymous function)                                               gutter.coffee:241
  module.exports.Gutter.updateFoldableClasses                        gutter.coffee:232
  module.exports.Gutter.updateLineNumbers                            gutter.coffee:170
  module.exports.EditorView.updateRenderedLines                      editor-view.coffee:999
  module.exports.EditorView.updateDisplay                            editor-view.coffee:909
  module.exports.EditorView.scrollTop                                editor-view.coffee:558
  (anonymous function)                                               editor-view.coffee:383
  jQuery.event.dispatch                                              /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4676
  elemData.handle                                                    /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4360
```

data.title: Add source map support in dev mode
data.body:
The translated js files would be shown under `(no domain)` and original coffee script source would be shown under `file://` in devtools' sources panel. Fixes #1448.

![source-map](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/639601/1971567/0d6f976a-8332-11e3-80b3-4cee9c26b614.gif)

data.title: Enable links from guide markdown to the generated API documentation
data.body: Is this already possible? If not, what's the most robust way to achieve it?

data.title: docs: occured -> occurred.
data.body: Just a small typo when perusing the docs trying to catch up. :)

data.title: Use file suffix to load specific platform keybindings.
data.body: For Example: On OS X, keymap files named `keymap.cson` and `darwin.cson` would load, but `win32.cson` would not load.

data.title: Cleanup workspace and its specs
data.body: This moves a lot of specs from the view layer to the model layer and cleans up workspace a bit. This is in preparation for the multiple-folders feature. There's still some more cleanup to do but I'd like to move on to other things.

data.title: Soft-wrap incorrectly applied to buffer with weird results
data.body:
I have no idea how I got into this situation, but it’s a strange one. In the following `.gif`, what I’m doing is simply pressing the left arrow key repeatedly.

![2014-01-21 at 5 38 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/1966105/64be3a40-82c3-11e3-8d14-7d6a20a821d3.png)

Note the following:
- When the cursor reaches the start of the initial line, the next leftwards movement jumps up an incorrect number of lines (should go immediately above).
- In the gutter, the soft-wrap indicator dots (if that’s what they are?) and line-numbers are completely out-of-sync with the contents of the editor’s buffer. For example, if I attempt to click my cursor onto the word "Sorry" a couple of lines above the one labelled as line 23, the cursor jumps to the end of the line labelled as line 12.
- (Not shown in the gif) I can’t click my cursor into any of the text with a dot in the line’s gutter. Doing so results in the cursor jumping upwards to the nearest line with a number in it’s gutter.

I’ve had soft-wrap enabled by default for a good week or so now, and haven’t run into any problems until now. I have no idea what combination of things led my editor into this state.

data.title: Overwriting default keyboard commands is confusing
data.body:
If I want to overwrite `ctrl-a` I have to make an overly specific selector (`.platform-darwin .editor` instead of just `.editor`)

![keymap cson - _users_corey_ atom](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/596/1965638/c6a1d372-82bc-11e3-895b-e8c9820d09ce.jpg)

I propose we get rid of the `.platform-darwin` selector and instead use filenames to selectively load keymaps. So all OS X specific binding files would end in `darwin` or `osx` and all windows specific binding files would end in `windows`

data.title: control + a now goes to beginning of line. It use to go to the beginning of the text on the line. Is
data.body:
control + a now goes to beginning of line. It use to go to the beginning of the text on the line. Is this intentional? I rarely find myself wanting to go to the very beginning of the line. 

I believe sublime goes to beginning of first text on line. If you are already there and press it again it goes to beginning of line.

data.title: Cleanup docs
data.body:
- [x] Remove doc warnings
- [x] Download includes instead of assuming they are already cloned
- [x] Include `Model` from theorist
- [x] Include `View` from space-pen
- [x] Add `docs/README.md`

data.title: Installed packages are not Git repositories
data.body:
It kinda sucks that when you install a package, the code you get installed locally isn’t usable instantly as a Git repository if you want to go and make changes, or check out a different branch of a package. Case in point:

![2014-01-20 at 7 13 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/1957342/33507b24-8207-11e3-863f-5b41075ddb5c.png)

So now, I have to `cd` up, `rm` the directory, reclone `atom/emmet`, `cd` back down again, and then check out the branch.

![2014-01-20 at 7 16 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/1957352/790481ba-8207-11e3-8fc9-caea22538344.png)

Would there be likely to be any crappy side-effects if we attempted to use the user’s git credentials to clone these down as usable repos whenever they’re installed via the settings/package manager?

data.title: Closing a tab activates the wrong tab
data.body:
I'm guessing that this is more of a personal preference thing, but it's bugged me several times so I thought I'd start a conversation around it.

I think it would be more natural for the tab to the _left_ of your active tab to activate when you close your active tab instead of the one to the right. This is especially true when you open a file with `cmd+t`, make a quick change, and then close it; I would expect to be back where I was before I opened the file, but instead I'm a tab over.

data.title: Source maps support
data.body: One thing that could really improve Atom's hackability would be the ability to debug CoffeeScript in its uncompiled form and always be able to rely on stack traces. @probablycorey took a stab at incorporating them but had some issues. @zcbenz, are there any obvious obstacles you know of to making it work?

data.title: Cannot switch between unsaved buffers with the same content
data.body:
Atom appears to have issues switching between unsaved buffers with the same content.

![atom-untitled-windows2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/189606/1950520/f61c9992-814b-11e3-9dab-2201161b1e2f.gif)
1. Create a new window
2. Create a new file
3. Observe you cannot switch to the second buffer
4. Type some text into the buffer
5. Observe that you can now switch to the second buffer
6. Type the same text into the second buffer
7. Observe that you can no longer switch to the first buffer
8. Change the text in the second buffer
9. Observe that you can now switch to the first buffer

Atom version b4dcec9
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/b4dcec9 Atom-Shell/0.8.5 Safari/537.36

data.title: Fix Windows build
data.body:
:no_bicycles: Not done yet :no_bicycles: 
- [x] Terminal package install failure.
- [x] Node-unzip doesn't work under node v0.11.x. (https://github.com/atom/node-ls-archive/issues/1 <del>https://github.com/atom/grunt-download-atom-shell/issues/2</del>)
- [ ] Use named pipe instead of unix file socket in the startup code on Windows
- [ ] It's very  hard to open command palette by key
- [ ] Some key shortcuts seem to be invoked for twice when typing
- [ ] The keybindings' icon in command palette doesn't show
- [ ] Add `atom.cmd`
- [ ] Make `grunt install` work
- [ ] Terminal package doesn't work
- [ ] High-DPI support
- [ ] Make all specs pass.

data.title: Allow folds to be toggled by clicking icons in the gutter
data.body:
Left to do:
- [x] Rename `fold` class to `folded` to match `foldable`
- [x] Indicate that multi-line comment blocks are foldable
- [x] Update foldable indicators when the indentation of a line changes
- [x] Update foldable indicators when a line is commented / uncommented
- [x] One last look at the CSS. Can it be simpler?
- [x] Fix positioning of the end of line fold indicators
- [x] Don't mark a commented line as foldable just because the next line is indented
- [x] Fix apm "base" theme
- [x] Publish new bookmarks package and upgrade to it
- [x] Remove backward-compatible shims from syntax themes after merging

![fold-indicators](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1789/1945171/43a38e8a-7fc8-11e3-8c2c-c284141a6ffd.gif)

I changed the layout of the gutter a bit to make the fold icon a real element rather than using pseudo elements. This is because I needed to detect if the icon specifically was clicked. I also opened up a bit more space in the gutter so things don't feel too squished.
